name: 11.17 "The Bar Manager, The Shrink..." Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: How long was Lilith in the Ecopod?
questions.explanation:
6 months.

	She said that after being underground for six months that it was good to see people again. Then she looked at the group and said, "Even you people."

questions.text: What did Lilith learn living in the Ecopod?
questions.correct: Two human beings cannot live together underground.
options: Two human beings find it hard to breath living underground.
The Ecopod is a great place to raise children.
The Ecopod was made for animals not humans.
questions.explanation:
Two human beings cannot live together underground.

	Lilith was living in the Ecopod with Dr. Louis Pascal. Pascal was the man she had an affair with a few episodes ago.

questions.text: Who took Norm's beer back when Frasier said he didn't take Lilith back?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	Sam gave everyone free drinks because he thought they were back together. When Frasier said they weren't Woody said, Sorry, Mr. Peterson" and took the drink away.

questions.text: What question did Sam ask Rebecca in the office?
questions.correct: So who was better, me or Frasier?
options: So can Frasier, you and I get together tomorrow?
Did Frasier kiss as good as me?
Does this mean you don't love me?
questions.explanation:
So who was better, me or Frasier?.

	As usual, Sam's ego needed reassuring from a woman. Rebecca never answered him and was annoyed he even asked.

options: Some nickname that Louis had for Lilith.
questions.explanation:
Surface dwellers.

	Dr. Pascal was referring to those people who lived above ground. He came to take Lilith back underground.

Reuben.

	Reuben was the busboy at Melville's. John Hill said Reuben was shot in the foot. This happened when Pascal fired the gun into the air to prove that he wasn't afraid to shoot.

questions.text: Why didn't Vera believe Norm when he said he was being held hostage?
options: Why would the people at Cheers be held hostage?
questions.explanation:
He used that excuse before.

	Norm often stayed out much later than he should, and then gave Vera excuses for it. He would rather be anywhere than home with his wife.

Louis' imaginary friend.

	Lilith said Louis was insane, which would explain why he was holding them hostage at the bar. He was also claustrophobic.

questions.text: Who sent the mail gram saying Lilith wanted a divorce?
questions.explanation:
Louis.

	Frasier, of course, thought Lilith sent it. Pascal said he wanted Frasier out of the picture so Lilith would return to him.

Yes.

	Lilith was going to give up when she realized there was no chance. However, as she was leaving she was sobbing, so he ended up taking her back.
